trans-unit.note: variable name - Default [https://code.google.com/p/blockly/wiki/Variables variable] representing a [https://code.google.com/p/blockly/wiki/Text piece of text]. This should be a single word, preferably short.

trans-unit.source: You have used up all the blocks for this level. To create a new block, you first need to delete an existing block.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown after the user has used all the blocks permitted on this level.

trans-unit.source: Click on %1 in the 'if' block to change its condition.
trans-unit.note: callout - %1 will be replaced with an image of the dropdown menu that the user needs to click.
title - Specifies that this is the '''Tunes''' tutorial.

trans-unit.source: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do the first block of actions. Otherwise, do the second block of actions.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.

trans-unit.source: Makes the player do what the blocks say.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button runs the computer program the user has written to move the player through the maze.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the enclosed actions until finish point is reached.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Repeat the enclosed commands until the tune has been successfully completed (the end point reached).
category - Blocks related to [https://code.google.com/p/blockly/wiki/Text text processing].

trans-unit.source: Sorry, '%1' doesn't correspond with any saved program.
trans-unit.note: alert - A request to retrieve a stored program does not have a valid URL. %1 is the invalid portion of the URL.

trans-unit.source: If-else blocks will do one thing or the other.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the 'if-else' block is introduced. For 'if-else' concatenate the words for 'if' and 'else/otherwise'.

trans-unit.source: Put the player back at the start of the maze.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button restores the player to the start position and enables the user's program to be run again.

trans-unit.source: You can fit more than one block inside a 'repeat' block.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is a hint that the user should place a second block inside of a 'repeat' block.\n\n'repeat' should be consistent with {lb}{lb}msg-blockly|Maze.repeatUntil{rb}{rb}.
Label on button for user to press when done reading help information.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|OK{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.
trans-unit.note: callout - The words for 'stack' and 'blocks' should be the same as for stacking children's blocks. Use the imperative verb form appropriate for speaking to a child, gender unspecified. If no gender-neutral singular/familiar form exists but a gender-neutral plural/formal form exists, use that instead. Be sure to use the same translation of 'move forward' as above.\n\n'move forward' refers to {lb}{lb}msg-blockly|Maze.moveForward{rb}{rb}.

trans-unit.source: Run your program to see what happens.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown after the user has created a program on the first level.

trans-unit.source: An 'if' block will do something only if the condition is true. Try turning left if there is a path to the left.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the 'if' block is introduced. An example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations! You have solved the final level.
trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the most difficult level.

trans-unit.source: On this level, you need to stack together all of the blocks in the white workspace.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is displayed if a user attempts to run a program composed of multiple stacks of blocks, letting them know they need to create a single stack.
tooltip - Clicking on this button will cause the current program to be saved and for a URL to be shown to later retrieve it.

trans-unit.source: Choose your favourite player from this menu.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is a hint that the user can change the appearance of the player that moves within the maze.

trans-unit.source: Could not load your saved file. Perhaps it was created with a different version of Blockly?
trans-unit.note: alert - There was a problem loading a file previously saved by the user. The most likely reason for the problem is that it was created with an earlier, incompatible version of Blockly. This message will be followed by technical information useful to engineers trying to understand the problem.
category - Blocks related to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subroutine defining or using procedures/functions].
tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes a program in the JavaScript computer language to be displayed, based on the program created by the user.
block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb for a playing a note.
button label - Pressing the button runs the computer program the user has written.

trans-unit.source: Share your blocks with this link:\n\n%1
trans-unit.note:
alert - After the user has pressed a button to save his/her program, this provides the URL (%1) to retrieve the program. The characters '

' indicate that a blank line will be displayed before the URL (in English). Leave those in unless you move %1 to the beginning or middle of the text, in which case you should use your judgment about where blank lines would be most useful.

Parameters:
* %1 - URL of saved program.

trans-unit.source: Run the program defined by the blocks in the workspace.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - Pressing this button runs the computer program the user has written.

trans-unit.source: There was a problem with the request.
trans-unit.note: alert - The URL is invalid or a server error occurred. This message will be followed by technical information useful to engineers trying to understand the problem.
button label - Pressing the button causes the output of the program to be erased but does not delete the user's program).

trans-unit.source: Congratulations! Are you ready to proceed to level %1?
trans-unit.note:
alert - This is displayed when the user solves the tune, inviting them to precede to the next level of difficulty.

Parameters:
* %1 - the number of the next level, which is always an integer greater than 1.

The project name. If readers of your language would know approximately how to pronounce 'Blockly', leave unchanged. Otherwise, include a transliteration in parentheses, such as the Russian: 'Blockly (\u0411\u043bo\u043a\u043b\u0438)'.

trans-unit.source: Reach the end of this path using only two blocks. Use 'repeat' to run a block more than once.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown when the 'repeat' block is introduced. The word 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.

block text - Conjunction meaning 'otherwise', introducing commands to be performed if a previous condition was not true, as in 'if x\u003E3, do this, else do that'. See [https://code.google.com/p/blockly/wiki/IfElse#If-Else_blocks].

block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb to repeat the following commands. The phrase is followed by the symbol denoting the end of the tune.

See also:
* {lb}{lb}msg-blockly|Maze.helpRepeatMany{rb}{rb}.

trans-unit.source: Can you solve this complicated maze? Try following the left-hand wall. Advanced programmers only!
trans-unit.note: callout - This advises the user to solve a maze by keeping his/her left hand in contact with the wall while proceding through it. The final sentence is a warning that only advanced programmers should attempt this problem, as beginners tend to get frustrated.
warning - No more blocks may be added until some are removed. Please include '%0' in the translated string. It will be replaced with '0' and made bold.
variable name - Default [https://code.google.com/p/blockly/wiki/Variables variable] representing a [https://code.google.com/p/blockly/wiki/Lists list]. This should be a single word, preferably short.

trans-unit.source: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do some actions.
trans-unit.note: tooltip - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.

block text - Imperative or infinitive of a verb preceding one or more commands to a person. This is part of [https://code.google.com/p/blockly/wiki/Loops#repeat repeat] and [https://code.google.com/p/blockly/wiki/IfElse#If_blocks if] blocks.

trans-unit.source: Your program didn't solve the maze. Press 'Reset' and try again.
trans-unit.note: callout - This is shown after the user has run a program that does not solve the maze.\n\n'Reset' refers to {lb}{lb}msg-blockly|Apps.resetProgram{rb}{rb}.
Label on button for user to press when not wanting to proceed.\n{lb}{lb}Identical|Cancel{rb}{rb}

trans-unit.source: If-else blocks will do one thing or the other.
